org.jcvi.jillion.assembly

Interface ContigBuilder<R extends AssembledRead,C extends Contig<R>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<C>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AsmContigBuilder, AsmUnitigBuilder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractContigBuilder, AceContigBuilder, DefaultContig.Builder, TasmContigBuilder, TigrContigBuilder

    public interface ContigBuilder<R extends AssembledRead,C extends Contig<R>>
extends Builder<C>
    ContigBuilder is a Builder for Contigs that allows creating a contig object by adding placed reads and setting a consensus. An ContigBuilder can be used to create contig objects that have been created by an assembler or can be used to create contigs from the imagination. There are additional methods to allow the contig consensus or underlying reads to be modified before the creation of the Contig instance (which is immutable).
    Author:
    dkatzel

      • getAllAssembledReadBuilders

        Collection<? extends AssembledReadBuilder<R>> getAllAssembledReadBuilders()
        Get a collection of all the AssembledReadBuilders that are currently associated with this contig. This collection is backed by the contig builder so any changes to the returned collection or modifications to any of its AssembledReadBuilders will modify the contig as well.
        Returns:
        a a collection of all the AssembledReadBuilder that are currently associated with this contig; never null.

      • getAssembledReadBuilder

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> getAssembledReadBuilder(String readId)
        Get the AssembledReadBuilder for the read in this contig with the given read id. Any changes to the returned instance will modify that read in this contig.
        Parameters:
        readId - the id of the read to get.
        Returns:
        a AssembledReadBuilder, will return null if no read with that id currently exists for this contig.

      • removeRead

        ContigBuilder<R,C> removeRead(String readId)
        Remove the read with the given read id from this contig. If this contig doesn't have a read with that readId, then the contig is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        readId - the read id to remove, can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if readId is null.

      • getConsensusBuilder

        NucleotideSequenceBuilder getConsensusBuilder()
        Get the NucleotideSequenceBuilder instance that will be the consensus in the built contig, any changes to the returned instance will modify the consensus in this contig.
        Returns:
        the NucleotideSequenceBuilder for this contig's consensus, never null.

      • recallConsensus

        ContigBuilder<R,C> recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller consensusCaller,
                                   QualitySequenceDataStore qualityDataStore,
                                   GapQualityValueStrategy qualityValueStrategy)
        Recall the consensus using the given ConsensusCaller and QualitySequenceDataStore which contains the quality data for all of the reads in this contig. The consensus will get recalled inside the build() and recallConsensusNow(). method before the Contig instance is created.
        Parameters:
        consensusCaller - the ConsensusCaller instance to use to recall the consensus of this contig; can not be null.
        qualityDataStore - the QualitySequenceDataStore which contains all the quality data for all of the reads in this contig; can not be null.
        qualityValueStrategy - the GapQualityValueStrategy to use to compute the quality scores of gaps; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.

      • recallConsensus

        ContigBuilder<R,C> recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller consensusCaller)
        Recall the consensus using the given ConsensusCaller using faked quality data where all basecalls (and gaps) all get the same quality value. The consensus will get recalled inside the build() and from recallConsensusNow(). method before the Contig instance is created.
        Parameters:
        consensusCaller - the ConsensusCaller instance to use to recall the consensus of this contig; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.

      • recallConsensusNow

        ContigBuilder<R,C> recallConsensusNow()
        Recompute the contig consensus now using the current reads in the contig using the ConsensusCaller and optional quality data that was set by recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller) or recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore, GapQualityValueStrategy). Only regions of the contig that have read coverage get recalled. The Consensus of "0x" regions remains unchanged. If this method is called without first setting a ConsensusCaller, then this method will throw an IllegalStateException.

        Recomputing the contig consensus may be computationally expensive and time consuming. So this method should not be called on a regular basis. Also, the contig consensus will always get recalled during build() even if this method has already been called since it is too hard to track if any underlying read changes occurred in between.

        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a consensus caller was not first set using recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller) or recallConsensus(ConsensusCaller, QualitySequenceDataStore, GapQualityValueStrategy).
        See Also:
        build()

      • build

        C build()
        Create a new instance using the data collected by this builder thus far.

        Take the current read and consensus data (which has possibly been previous edited and/or shifted) and create a new AceContig instance. Calling this method might release resources or destroy temp data that is required to built this contig, therefore this method should be only called once per builder instance. If this method is called more than once, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<C extends Contig<R>>
        Returns:
        a new AceContig instance, never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called more than once.
